Description: Attacker bypasses voice biometric authentication using recorded voice
Mitigation Strategy: Implement liveness detection, challenge-response protocol, and multi-factor authentication

Description: Deepfake or synthetic voice used to impersonate legitimate user
Mitigation Strategy: Advanced anti-spoofing algorithms, voice texture analysis, behavioral biometrics

Description: Interception of voice data or API communication
Mitigation Strategy: TLS 1.3 with certificate pinning, end-to-end encryption, mutual TLS for service communication

Description: Malicious SQL queries via voice-transcribed input
Mitigation Strategy: Parameterized queries, strict input validation, WAF with SQL injection detection

Description: Overwhelming system with voice requests
Mitigation Strategy: Rate limiting (100 req/min), adaptive throttling, DDoS protection at CDN level

Description: Unauthorized access to sensitive tax data or voice recordings
Mitigation Strategy: AES-256 encryption, access controls (RBAC), audit logging, regular penetration testing

Description: Stolen JWT tokens used for unauthorized access
Mitigation Strategy: Short token expiry (15 min), refresh token rotation, IP address binding, device fingerprinting

Description: Malicious employee accessing customer data
Mitigation Strategy: Principle of least privilege, separation of duties, comprehensive audit logging, background checks

Description: Excessive API calls or parameter tampering
Mitigation Strategy: Rate limiting per user/IP, schema validation, API gateway with request signing

Description: Unauthorized processing or retention of voice data
Mitigation Strategy: Data minimization, immediate deletion after processing, privacy by design, regular DPIAs

Description: Re-submission of captured voice authentication
Mitigation Strategy: Timestamp validation, nonce/challenge-response, session-specific tokens

Description: Brute force attack on Ügyfélkapu integration
Mitigation Strategy: Account lockout after 5 attempts, CAPTCHA after 3 attempts, IP reputation checking

Description: Malicious XML in NAV invoice submission
Mitigation Strategy: Disable XML external entities, strict XML schema validation, security-focused XML parser

Description: Injection of malicious scripts in web interface
Mitigation Strategy: Content Security Policy, output encoding, input sanitization, WAF protection

Description: Inadequate audit trail for security investigation
Mitigation Strategy: Centralized logging (SIEM), log integrity protection, real-time alerting on suspicious activities

Description: Exploits in NAV API or Ügyfélkapu integration
Mitigation Strategy: Regular security updates, vulnerability scanning, secure API wrapper, input validation

Description: Attacker manipulates user to reveal credentials
Mitigation Strategy: User education, warning messages, verification callbacks, transaction limits

Description: Weak encryption or key management
Mitigation Strategy: FIPS 140-2 certified HSM, regular key rotation, strong cipher suites only (TLS 1.3)

Description: Failure to meet GDPR or Hungarian data protection requirements
Mitigation Strategy: Regular compliance audits, DPO oversight, documented procedures, staff training

Description: Compromise through third-party dependencies
Mitigation Strategy: Software composition analysis, dependency scanning, vendor security assessments
